body_html:
How about something like:

raise ValueError('shuffle must be provided and explicitly set as boolean; '
                 'got {}'.format(shuffle))

or

raise ValueError('shuffle must be provided and explicitly set as True (for training) or False (otherwise); '
                 'got {}'.format(shuffle))

I like the first option since it concisely covers both the case of users not providing a value for shuffle and for users providing a non boolean value, but also doesn't assume the use case (users might want to shuffle in cases other than just training?)

body:
How about something like:

```
raise ValueError('shuffle must be provided and explicitly set as boolean; '
                 'got {}'.format(shuffle))
```

or 

```
raise ValueError('shuffle must be provided and explicitly set as True (for training) or False (otherwise); '
                 'got {}'.format(shuffle))
```

I like the first option since it concisely covers both the case of users not providing a value for `shuffle` and for users providing a non boolean value, but also doesn't assume the use case (users might want to shuffle in cases other than just training?)
